ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The people who have taqwa will be amid Gardens and Rivers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Surely those who fear God and follow the straight path will be amidst gardens and light,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Surely those who shun disobedience will dwell amidst Gardens and running streams
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The pious ones will live in Paradise wherein streams flow,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed the pious are amidst Gardens and springs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, those who have Taqwa, will be in the midst of Gardens and Rivers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely those who guard (against evil) shall be in gardens and rivers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely the godfearing shall dwell amid gardens and a river
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! the righteous will dwell among gardens and rivers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The God-conscious will find themselves in gardens and rivers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily the God-fearing will be in Gardens and among rivers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed the Godwary will be amid gardens and streams,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: As to the Righteous, they will be in the midst of Gardens and Rivers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, The Muttaqun (pious), will be in the midst of Gardens and Rivers (Paradise).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Indeed, the cautious shall live amid gardens and a river,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The righteous will be amidst gardens and rivers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and rivers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [54:54] Assuredly the God-fearing will be amid gardens, orchards, and rivers (the collective noun is meant here; a variant reading [for nahar] has the plural nuhur, similar [in form] to asad, ‘lion’, [plural] usud), the meaning being that they will drink from its rivers water milk, honey and wine;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! the righteous) those who ward off disbelief, idolatry and indecencies (will dwell among Gardens and rivers) many rivers; and it is said: in vast meadows,
